page.title: 14Employment in Alvechurch.
page.content: In Alvechurch in the 1940's, the population was under 2000 people. Not all of them needed employment, some were retired, and some were children. Today, the population of the village stands at around 3500, with proportionately higher level of employment age. Then most of the people worked in the Needle Factory in Redditch, or producing cars in the Austin factories in Longbridge. If not, perhaps producing fishing tackle, nuts and bolts, or springs. These factories were also in the area or quite near, and so many people including farmers and shop keepers, then worked in Alvechurch. Alvechurch, now a dormitory town, houses commuters, teachers, farmers, shopkeepers and health service people work here. Delsons, H.Kedward Ltd and Project Engineering thrive.
